pageContext.description:
This portrait of Philipp Melanchthon corresponds with a type that evolved in 1532 and was subsequently reproduced numerous times. Further examples of the same format are preserved in Berlin, Dresden, Regensburg and Munich. It shows the scholar and reformer in three-quarter profile against a monochrome blue background facing left. He is wearing a black gown and his hands are folded in his lap. 
[cda 2020]
